Description: Fragment of a scarab, made of faience, the left half of the scarab is preserved. Fine details carved, whitish colour with incised lines, faint remains of a light green glaze. The division between elytra and prothorax is not shown. There was some sort of decoration on prothorax, like a curve. No humeral callosities shown. The head is very stylized, no eyes visible, half of the clypeus is broken off, no lobes indicated, but the plate is carved with small parallel lines. The side shows a each three legs in relief on top of a band for the base. The legs show small lines for the hair as well. The seal at the base shows an oval line framing the base, the motif shows the upper part of a winged scarab, lined by two other signs, maybe nb-baskets. On top of the kheper a short horizontal line. Perforated along its longitudinal side.
